AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile.synopsis: This is an all-purpose combat-starting AD on the Inquisitor, if and when he turns the full crèche hostile. It plays for a number of edge-cases that are the result of the player trespassing and if the player leaves the security office during the Vlaakith scene. It also plays at the start of the combat when he betrays the player on Vlaakith's command.
AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile.how_to_trigger: Go to 1357; 0; -762 without watchin the captain-templar dialog in the captain's office. It will trigger the tresspassing reaction from the templar and start the attack.

AD_TemplarCombatMindstealLine.synopsis: He casts Projectile_CRE_GithyankiInquisitor_Mindsteal_Link for the first time

AD_TemplarCombatThirdLine.synopsis: Last of three ADs that play at the start of a combat turn for the Inquisitor.
AD_TemplarCombatThirdLine.how_to_trigger: Plays on the third (or later) turn of the Inquisitor in the combat against him

PAD_InactivePlanecasterComment.synopsis: The player attempts to use an inactive planecaster in the security office of the Creche, and comments on it. The planecaster unlocks the Orpheus Box, but this PAD covers both knowing and not knowing that.
PAD_InactivePlanecasterComment.how_to_trigger: Go to 1357; -11; -660 in CRE_Main_A, and interact with S_CRE_SecurtiyOfficePlanecaster (don't talk to the Inquisitor beforehand).

AD_TemplarGreeting.synopsis: The Inquisitor greets the player and invites them to talk to him. He gets increasingly impatient if the player keeps ignoring him, ending with combat if the player doesn't go talk to him.Custom greeting node if he notices a player sneaking around.
AD_TemplarGreeting.how_to_trigger: Enter the Inquisitor's office at 1357; -5; -681 in CRE_Main_A

AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine.synopsis: First of three ADs that play at the start of a combat turn for the Inquisitor.
AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine.how_to_trigger: Plays on the first turn of the Inquisitor's combat

LaezelAtPlanecaster.synopsis: One-liner telling players to put the artefact in the Planecaster
LaezelAtPlanecaster.how_to_trigger: Dialog set on Laezel while she's waiting at the Planecaster

AD_LaezelTurnsHostile.synopsis: Lae'zel says this AD as she attacks the player for the following actions:- You walk out of the Creche Security office after Vlaakith orders you to enter the Astral Prism- You attack the Inquisitor
AD_LaezelTurnsHostile.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_AMake sure you have Laezel with you.Go to 1392; -2; -780 and enter the captain's office and get through the dialoggo to 1357; -7; -689enter the security officetalk to the inquisitor, and show him the artifacttalk to Vlaakith and tell her you won't do itLaezel should have left the party and is waiting for you to enter the Astral PrismLeave the security office - Lae'zel will go hostile, and trigger this AD.

Vlaakith.synopsis: Vlaakith appears through the planecaster. Vlaakith explains that there's a prisoner inside who needs to be killed for the safety of the gith and activates he planecaster so it can be used to open the artefact.
Vlaakith.how_to_trigger: Go to 1357; 0; -785 in CRE_Main_A. Enter the captain's office, and go thorugh the dialogs as you want. Go to the Security office.Go through the Inquisitor dialog and show the artefact, or kill the inquisitor. This dialog automatically triggers afterwards.

DaisyAD_UsePlanecaster.synopsis: Daisy AD for when we click on the planecaster to start the process of entering the astral plane
DaisyAD_UsePlanecaster.how_to_trigger: CRE > Chain of Command > Inquisitor passage > talk to the inquisitor then Vlaakith and don't anger her > click on the planecaster

Templar.synopsis: The inquisitor demands the Orpheus artefact. The player can ask questions or attempt to hand over the artefact, which leads to Vlaakith appearing through the planecaster. Vlaakith explains that there's a prisoner inside who needs to be killed for the safety of the gith and teleports the player into the Astral Prison. Alternatively the player can kill the inquisitor and prompt Vlaakith’s appearance themselves.
Templar.how_to_trigger: Enter the security office room in the lower gith creche or get spotted while sneaking into it. Detect thoughts is a useful spell to have for this dialogue.

DaisyAD_KilledInquisitor.synopsis: Daisy AD for when we kill the inquisitor
DaisyAD_KilledInquisitor.how_to_trigger: CRE > Chain of Command > Inquisitor passage > talk to the inquisitor and kill him

TemplarStartsFight.synopsis: The templar knows you failed to carry out your mission and will try to kill you for it, carries the beat that Vlaakith has betrayed you.
TemplarStartsFight.how_to_trigger: Plays when you come back from the astral plane and the templar is still a live.

AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster.synopsis: Laezel tells the player to place the Artefact in the Planecaster. She is more demanding and makes it clear that she will fight them if they don't do it.
AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically after the CRE_ChainOfCommand_Vlaakith_OM_Laezel_COM if the player accepted Vlaaktih's orders or refused and Laezel wasn't convinced.

SWD_Templar.how_to_trigger: Go To 1357; 0; -762, kill the Templar, and cast SWD on his corpse.

AD_TemplarCombatSecondLine.synopsis: Second of three ADs that play at the start of a combat turn for the Inquisitor.
AD_TemplarCombatSecondLine.how_to_trigger: Plays on the second (or later)  turn of the Inquisitor's combat

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Several sessions are clearly part of branching encounter sequences and combat turn sequences. For example, the Inquisitor’s combat ADs come in a series: the greeting (AD_TemplarGreeting) happens prior to the onset of combat, then the combat ADs occur in order—first turn (AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine), then on subsequent turns (AD_TemplarCombatSecondLine and AD_TemplarCombatThirdLine). Separately, when talking with the inquisitor in the security office, the session named 'Templar' (in which the inquisitor demands the artefact) is encountered. In that branch the player may either engage in dialogue leading to Vlaakith’s appearance or choose to kill the inquisitor (triggering DaisyAD_KilledInquisitor) – these two outcomes are mutually exclusive. In the dialogue branch the follow‐up is the appearance of Vlaakith (session ‘Vlaakith’), while in the kill branch that same Vlaakith dialog is triggered after the inquisitor is killed. Also, if after a chain-of-command sequence involving the planecaster the player follows Lae’zel’s orders to use the artefact correctly, the session AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster occurs; however, if the player instead incites Lae’zel by leaving the security office or attacking the inquisitor, then AD_LaezelTurnsHostile is triggered – these two sessions form mutually exclusive outcomes. In addition, one branch of the combat sequence involves a side effect: during combat, after greeting (AD_TemplarGreeting), if combat ensues then AD_TemplarCombatMindstealLine is one of the actions the inquisitor takes – though its ordering relative to the first combat line is not as strictly defined as the sequential numbering of the other combat ADs, so we are not including it in the explicit order list. Finally, if the player ends up killing the inquisitor (the DaisyAD_KilledInquisitor branch) then an additional SWD_Templar session occurs upon killing the inquisitor, which is mutually exclusive with the dialogue branch where the inquisitor remains alive. Also, after initiating the astral plane entry by clicking the planecaster (DaisyAD_UsePlanecaster), if the templar is still live then TemplarStartsFight is triggered. These relationships yield the ordering and exclusiveness constraints below.

AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile_0.text: Crèche Y'llek - with me! To the death.

AD_TemplarGreeting_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting_0.text: You have something I want. I have the knowledge you need.

AD_TemplarGreeting_1.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting_1.text: I can tell you more than any amount of skulking around would. Come. Speak.

AD_TemplarGreeting_2.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting_2.text: Shame. Such an illustrious journey, ended by poor etiquette.

AD_TemplarGreeting_3.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting_3.text: Vlaakith's power is endless - her patience is not. Approach. I won't ask again.

AD_TemplarGreeting_4.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting_4.text: Ah. Our esteemed guest. Please, approach - we have much to discuss.

AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine_0.text: Your life is over. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!

LaezelAtPlanecaster_0.speaker: Lae'zel
LaezelAtPlanecaster_0.text: Insert the artefact - or I take it from your corpse. This is the way forward.

LaezelAtPlanecaster_1.speaker: Lae'zel
LaezelAtPlanecaster_1.text: Place the artefact in the planecaster. I'm waiting.

AD_LaezelTurnsHostile_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelTurnsHostile_0.text: I warned you, and you still turn away. This will not stand!

Vlaakith_111.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player reacting to hearing a disembodied voice. NodeContext: Vlaakith should sligjhtly overpronounce every word, think Davros from Doctor Who, each syllable drips with a kind of mad, ancient evil

Vlaakith_32.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The planecaster vibrates, shaking the ground around it. 
Flares of light curl up in its centre and grow to full form. 
Vlaakith appears, awesome and terrible, at least twice the size of any human, a hologram in a haze of astral flares.

Vlaakith_6.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Vlaakith_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Inquisitor kneels before Vlaakith's image, surprised to see her. All of his staff kneel also. NodeContext: pronounced VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI (meaning 'For the honour of Vlaakith!')

Vlaakith_109.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_109.text: *Your vision throbs with ink-black darkness as your patron borrows your gaze - beholding the vision in front of you.*

Vlaakith_20.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_20.text: *Not exactly a god - but not far off. Your patron recoils, but not before leaving a word of advice - caution.*

Vlaakith_114.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_114.text: *The queen who brings conquest to the heavens, sundering planets, destroying the very stars.*

Vlaakith_10.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_10.text: *Hot envy swirls within. Your guts will you to author such cosmic tragedies as she has.*

Vlaakith_58.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_58.text: You are permitted to look upon me. You are invited to kneel.

Vlaakith_13.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_13.context: NodeContext: her facade splinters a little, letting her mad, immortal rage take over

Vlaakith_43.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_43.text: I am Vlaakith. Undying Queen of the noble githyanki. God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath.
Vlaakith_43.context: NodeContext: anger should build rhythmically here, each consonant semi-spat in rage

Vlaakith_131.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: vlaakith bellows this in the face of the player, before stopping herself, and recovering her composure slightlyNodeContext: she loses her shit here, before collecting herself

Vlaakith_66.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_66.text: Stay standing, just as you are.

Vlaakith_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Inquisitor frowns at your insolence.

Vlaakith_76.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Vlaakith_76.text: Did your crèche teach you nothing?
Vlaakith_76.context: InternalNodeContext: The Inquisitor hisses at the player while kneeling.

Vlaakith_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith, unfazed in the least, considers you with critical interest.

Vlaakith_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith looms in to face the player at their eye level.

Vlaakith_123.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_123.text: You bear that which is ours. But are you friend, or are you thief?

Vlaakith_5.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_5.text: I didn't steal it, it just... found me.

Vlaakith_44.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_44.text: Friend - I came to bring it back to you.

Vlaakith_127.speaker: Astarion
Vlaakith_127.text: You're what? That is the only thing keeping us from a gruesome, tentacled-filled future.
Vlaakith_127.context: NodeContext: Response to "I'm giving the artefact to Vlaakith"

Vlaakith_62.speaker: Wyll
Vlaakith_62.text: Are you mad? That artefact's the only thing shielding us from the Absolute's voice.

Vlaakith_60.speaker: Lae'zel
Vlaakith_60.text: Vlaakith has spoken. You have listened. This is the way.

Vlaakith_85.speaker: Shadowheart
Vlaakith_85.text: Fool - that artefact is the only thing keeping us safe. She cannot have it.
Vlaakith_85.context: NodeContext: Angry. Player is trying to give their lifeline and the object of her mission away.

Vlaakith_47.speaker: Karlach
Vlaakith_47.text: Hey - wait! That's the only thing keeping us from transforming!

Vlaakith_21.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_21.text: An unexpected servant. Your will is strong.

Vlaakith_52.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_52.text: Your kind's stoic endurance will be a boon to our cause.

Vlaakith_12.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_12.text: Your kind's heritage is long and storied. It is an honour to be served by one so noble.

Vlaakith_42.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_42.text: Your kind is not known for trusting strangers. Quite rightly. Yet here you are.

Vlaakith_69.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_69.text: You have ventured far from your kind's comforts to serve us.

Vlaakith_3.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_3.text: Descendant of noble dragons - you honour us with your allyship.

Vlaakith_140.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_140.text: Extend your fealty one step further, and you will be rewarded beyond your mortal reckoning.
Vlaakith_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith returns to her full posture.

Vlaakith_132.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_132.text: Your kind will go far for glory. As you have shown by being here.

Vlaakith_25.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_25.text: My child. You walk on the path of ascension.

Vlaakith_92.speaker: Gale
Vlaakith_92.text: How generous of you - but perhaps you've forgotten we need it ourselves? That thing is keeping us safe.

Vlaakith_73.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_73.text: Neither - I came here looking for a cure for my tadpole.

Vlaakith_102.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_102.text: And you just happened to STUMBLE on the Astral Prism?
Vlaakith_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: A visual flare as she experiences intense emotion. NodeContext: completely incredulous

Vlaakith_100.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: A long pause. Player waits awkwardly for Vlaakith to say something. NodeContext: Scary and torn while she considers you

Vlaakith_41.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_41.text: At least you brought it back. It is a start.

Vlaakith_80.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_80.text: We will test you. To assess whether you deserve reward or punishment.
Vlaakith_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith returns to her full posture.

Vlaakith_87.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_87.text: The Astral Prism - it is corrupted.
Vlaakith_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith summons a floating hologram of the artefact and psionically spins it, toying with it.

Vlaakith_77.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Vlaakith_77.text: I shall cleanse it for you, my queen. Tell me how.
Vlaakith_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: W'wargaz stands, appealing to his queen, desperate to be given this twisted honourInternalNodeContext: He's not altogether sure why this task is falling to the player and not to him, but also doesn't want to challenge his queen's motivations.

Vlaakith_72.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: After he is rebuked, W'wargaz stands sulkily behind the player

Vlaakith_125.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_125.text: There is someone inside. Their mind is warped, broken - a blight.

Vlaakith_90.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_90.text: They are an agent of the Grand Design. Sent to sabotage the Astral Prism - our last defence against the return of the Illithid Empire.

Vlaakith_27.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_27.text: As long as they live, the Prism is compromised.

Vlaakith_113.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_113.text: Find the one inside and destroy them. Be aware - they are not alone, and they will appeal to your trust. They are not to be believed.
Vlaakith_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a close of her fist, the artefact hologram is shattered in mid-air in a burst of astral flare.

Vlaakith_1.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_1.text: My skills and fate are not subject to your whims.

Vlaakith_78.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_78.text: So the dream visitor is inside the artefact... I can't kill them. They protect me from the Absolute.

Vlaakith_17.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room rumbles, the gith (and inquisitor) in here look terrifiedNodeContext: she loses herself a bit in rage here,

Vlaakith_144.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_144.text: Fine. I will go in and kill them.

Vlaakith_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith looks the player over, and gives a ghastly, frightening smile.

Vlaakith_45.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_45.text: No. In fact, maybe I'll free the one inside.

Vlaakith_9.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_9.context: NodeContext: leering - you won't be allowed to get away with this

Vlaakith_104.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_104.text: Use this to enter the Prism, or deny me. The choice is yours.
Vlaakith_104.context: InternalNodeContext: follow up with act 3 consequence during gith invasion

Vlaakith_8.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_8.text: But know this: my wrath is carried with each of my faithful. It will find you.

Vlaakith_4.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_4.text: W'wargaz - kill it. Enter the Prism yourself. See that protocol is done.
Vlaakith_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The image of Vlaakith flickers away within the planecaster, replaced by an image of the artefact suspended above the device.

Vlaakith_7.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_7.text: If you're a god, do it yourself.

Vlaakith_135.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_135.text: My oath is sworn to the ancient magic of this world - not your astral empire. I owe you nothing.

Vlaakith_81.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_81.text: It is my greatest honour to obey.

Vlaakith_82.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_82.text: I will do as you wish.

Vlaakith_88.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_88.text: The god-queen of my people cannot kill someone herself?

Vlaakith_48.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_48.text: Perhaps I misheard. You would not speak ill of a god. Would you?
Vlaakith_48.context: NodeContext: again, she's close to losing it a bit here, "would you" said with max venom

Vlaakith_106.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_106.text: I spoke too hastily - please forgive me.

Vlaakith_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The image of Vlaakith flickers away within the planecaster, replaced by an image of the artefact suspended above the device.

Vlaakith_14.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_14.text: Use the planecaster's power to enter the Prism.

Vlaakith_35.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Vlaakith_35.text: An istik... A crusader for my queen... Unimaginable. You are blessed, istik. Do not fail her!
Vlaakith_35.context: NodeContext: gith variant said with gritted teeth, non gith variant said almost muttered to self

Vlaakith_119.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_119.text: Be wary of the creature's lying tongue. Cut it out, if you must.

Vlaakith_130.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_130.text: I just think a real god could kill whoever she wants.

Vlaakith_59.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: at the word "wish", Vlaakith invokes the most powerful, reality-bending magic of the multiverse. The Wish. her image shakes, as does the room around the players. we cut to gameplay, and they die .

Vlaakith_33.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_33.text: Find the one inside and kill them. Be aware - they are not alone, and they will appeal to your trust. They are not to be believed.
Vlaakith_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a close of her fist, the artefact hologram is shattered in mid-air in a burst of astral flare.

Vlaakith_118.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_118.text: You must accept. Refuse, and know my fury.

Vlaakith_105.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_105.text: Can't you kill the one inside yourself? I thought 'gods' were all-powerful.

Vlaakith_145.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_145.text: No way. I don't work for deluded tyrants.

Vlaakith_19.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_19.text: Try to peer into your queen's mind.

Vlaakith_64.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_64.text: *Behind the veil of the god-queen's outer thoughts - death. Fear. Paranoia.*
Vlaakith_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reads Vlaakith's thoughts with difficulty.

Vlaakith_108.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_108.text: *She fears the one inside the artefact more than anything in the world. But she's hiding something.*

Vlaakith_103.speaker: Narrator
Vlaakith_103.text: *The veil snaps back. Vlaakith's mind shut out to you forever.*
Vlaakith_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player recovers from reading Vlaakith's thoughts.

Vlaakith_116.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_116.text: Does it matter? I brought it back to you.

Vlaakith_136.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_136.text: That is no answer to my question.

Vlaakith_115.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_115.text: Yours? I found it. The artefact is mine.

Vlaakith_61.speaker: Astarion
Vlaakith_61.text: Surely there's a more tactful way to say that? One that won't get us killed?

Vlaakith_16.speaker: Wyll
Vlaakith_16.text: By the Nine Hells - she's not going to like that.

Vlaakith_91.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_91.text: To own something is to know it. You know NOTHING of what you carry.

Vlaakith_133.speaker: Lae'zel
Vlaakith_133.text: Fool. You speak with the Lich Queen. You do not refuse Vlaakith.

Vlaakith_129.speaker: Shadowheart
Vlaakith_129.text: Good. Whatever happens to us, the lich queen must not take the artefact.

Vlaakith_126.speaker: Karlach
Vlaakith_126.text: Gods, she's gonna rip our legs off.

Vlaakith_18.speaker: Gale
Vlaakith_18.text: I don't think she's the type who hears 'no' very often...

Vlaakith_79.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_79.text: I am more than friend. I am your most loyal servant.

Vlaakith_23.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_23.text: I didn't steal anything, but Shadowheart here...

Vlaakith_146.speaker: Shadowheart
Vlaakith_146.context: NodeContext: Outraged. The player just ratted her out.

Vlaakith_74.speaker: Shadowheart
Vlaakith_74.text: That's it. We're dead, thanks to you.
Vlaakith_74.context: NodeContext: Outraged. The player just ratted her out.

Vlaakith_107.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Vlaakith_107.text: I expected little of istik education, but here we kneel before our queen.

Vlaakith_84.speaker: Player
Vlaakith_84.text: Kneel: choke down your brutal pride.

Vlaakith_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player waves politely at Vlaakith.

Vlaakith_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player kneels, head bowed, solemn, appropriate. Vlaakith offers something resembling a smile, and gestures for the player to rise. The player rises.

Vlaakith_120.speaker: Vlaakith
Vlaakith_120.text: Inquisitor W'wargaz was potent. We are impressed.
Vlaakith_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player reacting to hearing a disembodied voice.NodeContext: Vlaakith should sligjhtly overpronounce every word, think Davros from Doctor Who, each syllable drips with a kind of mad, ancient evil

Templar_129.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_129.text: My ardents spoke of one of our kin that escaped a crashing ghaik slave-vessel.

Templar_92.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_92.text: You have accomplished much, child. I am pleased to finally meet you.

Templar_79.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_79.text: Interesting. My ardents reported that an istik survived the crashed ghaik slave-vessel.

Templar_15.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_15.text: You have accomplished much since. I am pleased to finally meet you.

Templar_91.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_91.text: I heard there is so much goblin blood on your hands that it soaks their children's nightmares.

Templar_41.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_41.text: Kith'rak Voss' made a mistake when he let you go.

Templar_115.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_115.text: To business. I suspect you plucked something precious from the ghaik ship. Something that belongs to us.

Templar_104.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_104.text: The weapon. Give it to me.

Templar_99.speaker: Narrator
Templar_99.text: *The artefact stirs in your pocket. Right within your grasp, and desperate not to be relinquished.*

Templar_164.text: Don't do it. The weapon is how I protect you.

Templar_90.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_90.text: Do it. Do not disobey the Inquisitor.

Templar_61.speaker: Player
Templar_61.text: I can give it to you, but I don't think you'll like it.

Templar_59.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_59.text: Perhaps you should leave the thinking to me, istik. Hand over the weapon.

Templar_106.speaker: Player
Templar_106.text: This weapon - what does it do?

Templar_148.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_148.text: What business is that of yours? Suffice to say, my queen wants it.

Templar_54.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_54.text: But know that you will have been instrumental in stopping the Grand Design.

Templar_70.speaker: Player
Templar_70.text: Is the ghaik incursion not more important?

Templar_160.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_160.text: You mean the Grand Design? The restoration of the Illithid Empire? Why, it is of the utmost importance.
Templar_160.context: NodeContext: as if talking about something super obvious that you're an idiot not to have heard of

Templar_142.speaker: Player
Templar_142.text: Shouldn't you be more concerned with the mind flayer invasion?

Templar_37.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_37.text: What makes you think we are not? We are talking about the Grand Design - the restoration of the Illithid Empire. There is nothing of greater importance.
Templar_37.context: NodeContext: as if talking about something super obvious that you're an idiot not to have heard of

Templar_103.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_103.text: But the weapon is the solution. I have heard it directly from Queen Vlaakith herself.

Templar_109.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_109.text: It is how we will stop the mind flayers before they destroy us all.

Templar_113.speaker: Player
Templar_113.text: How do you know so much about me?

Templar_118.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_118.text: Some of your species say knowledge is power. They are wrong. Knowledge is everything.

Templar_10.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_10.text: Indeed? And what does it protect you from?

Templar_73.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_73.text: Well you know what they say about fears. The best thing you can do is face them.

Templar_56.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_56.text: Here. Let me put your lights out. Hta'zith!

Templar_43.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_43.text: If you hear that voice at all, then you are infected.

Templar_66.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_66.text: And it is my people who need protecting from you. Hta'zith!

Templar_86.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_86.text: No matter. Death will cure you of that problem.

Templar_128.speaker: Player
Templar_128.text: All kinds of bad things. It's my lucky charm.

Templar_4.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_4.text: You really have no idea what it is, do you?

Templar_139.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_139.text: But you were not wrong to observe that you need protection.

Templar_96.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_96.text: Once the Grand Design comes into effect and the Illithid Empire is restored, all life will be over as you know it.

Templar_9.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_9.text: We took an interest in you when you became involved with this 'Absolute' cult. A pestilence of infected slaves - the first symptom of the Grand Design in action.

Templar_78.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_78.text: But you are lucky - that weapon you carry is the solution. I have heard it from Queen Vlaakith herself.

Templar_28.speaker: Player
Templar_28.text: What do I get in return if I give it to you?

Templar_11.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_11.text: The ghaik are about to execute their Grand Design and you seek to bargain. P'hak'va.

Templar_100.speaker: Player
Templar_100.text: I have the weapon - I would say that puts me in a strong position to bargain with you.

Templar_75.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_75.text: Is that so? Well, then - humour me. What would you ask of an Inquisitor?
Templar_75.context: InternalNodeContext: He's only playing along for his own entertainment. He doesn't believe we have anything to offer him. NodeContext: Bemused, snarky

Templar_154.speaker: Player
Templar_154.text: Make me your best offer. I accept gold.

Templar_83.speaker: Player
Templar_83.text: I could use an ally against the illithids. As could you.

Templar_124.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_124.text: If you desire to see the might of my people, you will not be disappointed.

Templar_126.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_126.text: Our swords are ready to cleave ghaik flesh in their legions. With or without your interference.

Templar_26.speaker: Player
Templar_26.text: Give me a treasure from the Githyanki Empire's coffers. One of immense power.

Templar_125.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_125.text: You would lay claim to our hard-won treasures? You seek power but do not seek to strive for it?

Templar_136.speaker: Player
Templar_136.text: Coin, typically - but anything of immense value will do.

Templar_159.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_159.text: You hold the key to thwarting the ghaik Grand Design - and you ask me for coin? Petty trinkets?

Templar_112.speaker: Player
Templar_112.text: I bet your empire has gathered countless valuable spellbooks in its time - let me read them.

Templar_116.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_116.text: You stand before an Inquisitor of Vlaakith and ask for... reading material?

Templar_55.speaker: Player
Templar_55.text: You githyanki are disciplined warriors - I wish to learn your ways.

Templar_138.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_138.text: Gish war-arts far eclipse the reckoning of istik minds.

Templar_76.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_76.text: However, you will readily witness our silver swords cleave putrid ghaik flesh if you do but one thing -

Templar_95.speaker: Player
Templar_95.text: A promotion in the eyes of our Queen. I want my silver sword.

Templar_123.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_123.text: Only this? Gladly. Once you hand me the artefact.
Templar_123.context: InternalNodeContext: You had the chance to negotiate for something more and blew it on something he was going to give you anyway.NodeContext: with ridicule

Templar_6.speaker: Player
Templar_6.text: On second thoughts, I don't need anything of yours.

Templar_94.speaker: Player
Templar_94.text: Here's how deals like this work: I have something you need. I can bargain all I like.

Templar_98.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_98.text: I do not know what base, naive entities you have made deals with before - nor do I care.

Templar_31.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_31.text: But I will humour your greed for a moment. What would you ask of an Inquisitor?

Templar_25.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_25.text: The Grand Design is what all ghaik seek. The restoration of the Illithid Empire, which spanned the entirety of the multiverse.

Templar_166.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_166.text: For centuries, their elder brains sought to bring back their dominion. Every plot they hatched, we stopped. But now, they are close to succeeding.

Templar_65.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_65.text: Never before could they pause ceremorphosis. Never before could they let the infection spread undetected.

Templar_23.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_23.text: Imagine that everywhere. Wants, needs, choice - all would cease to be.

Templar_2.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_2.text: This is what we have all been training for.

Templar_57.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_57.text: You saw the thralls gathered on the ghaik ship.

Templar_5.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_5.text: It was a vision of the future. Luckily, our queen is here to guide us. She will lead us to victory.

Templar_131.speaker: Player
Templar_131.text: I won't let you take it.

Templar_102.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_102.text: Do not try me. Hand over the artefact, or die by my hand.
Templar_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Threatening and confident. She means what she says.

Templar_122.speaker: Player
Templar_122.text: You can't trust him, Lae'zel. Follow my lead. I will choose the right path.

Templar_127.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_127.text: Tsk - tsk - tsk'va! I hate that you speak the truth.
Templar_127.context: NodeContext: tsk tsk tsk-VA! Basically saying, SHIT SHIT SHIT!

Templar_158.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_158.text: Choose. Your path is mine to follow.

Templar_81.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_81.text: I know my path. Refuse him the artefact, and it will run with your blood.

Templar_144.speaker: Player
Templar_144.text: You can't trust him, Lae'zel. Follow my lead. I will choose the right path.

Templar_0.speaker: Player
Templar_0.text: Remember the zaith'isk? These gith can't be trusted. Follow my lead - I'll choose the right path.

Templar_64.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_64.text: The zaith'isk... Tsk - tsk - tsk'va! I hate that you speak the truth.
Templar_64.context: NodeContext: tsk tsk tsk-VA! Basically saying, SHIT SHIT SHIT!

Templar_30.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Seething anger, quiet but roiling.

Templar_16.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_16.text: Your illustrious adventure ends here. Hta'zith!

Templar_62.speaker: Lae'zel
Templar_62.text: Our fate is forged. Mother Gith, guide us!
Templar_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player.NodeContext: Gearing up for battle

Templar_29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches to produce the artefact. 
The inquisitor reaches to take it but is interrupted.

Templar_151.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_151.text: Then your illustrious adventure ends here. Hta'zith!

Templar_72.speaker: Player
Templar_72.text: I thought the Grand Design was a ghaik philosophy, not an actual plan.

Templar_53.speaker: Player
Templar_53.text: How will this weapon stop the mind flayers?

Templar_101.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_101.text: That is a secret known only to Queen Vlaakith. Its significance is beyond both of our stations.

Templar_143.speaker: Player
Templar_143.text: How will this weapon actually stop the ghaik?

Templar_17.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_17.text: Did your crèche teach you nothing? That knowledge belongs to Queen Vlaakith alone. It is not for us to know nor question.

Templar_157.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_157.text: You know more than you're letting on.

Templar_132.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_132.text: I have seen your behaviour before. The squirming, the avoidance. You are infected.

Templar_162.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_162.text: You also killed Sarth Baretha. She was formidable.

Templar_108.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_108.text: I heard enough druids died by your hand to make the deity Silvanus himself weep.

Templar_45.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_45.text: It must not have been easy to escape.

Templar_114.speaker: Player
Templar_114.text: My mind is silver, and my body steel. Vlaakith expects no less of me.

Templar_120.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
Templar_120.text: Place the weapon in the planecaster. Fulfil our Queen's most holy edict.

DaisyAD_KilledInquisitor_0.text: I'm glad you came to your senses - now leave. Before the others come for us.

TemplarStartsFight_9.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
TemplarStartsFight_9.text: Our queen spoke to me. You have failed - your death has been decreed.

TemplarStartsFight_11.speaker: Player
TemplarStartsFight_11.text: Your queen is lying to you. You shouldn't listen to a damn thing she says.

TemplarStartsFight_7.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
TemplarStartsFight_7.text: Since my queen does not lie, I must assume you do.

TemplarStartsFight_13.speaker: Player
TemplarStartsFight_13.text: I don't know what you mean. I killed the person inside.

TemplarStartsFight_6.speaker: Player
TemplarStartsFight_6.text: I couldn't do it. I couldn't destroy the one protecting me from the Absolute.

TemplarStartsFight_8.speaker: Player
TemplarStartsFight_8.text: Whoever it was I saw in there, they definitely weren't who Vlaakith described.

TemplarStartsFight_12.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
TemplarStartsFight_12.text: My queen spoke true. And so, you die.

TemplarStartsFight_5.speaker: Player
TemplarStartsFight_5.text: It was kind of you to unlock the artefact for me. I'll be leaving now.

TemplarStartsFight_10.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
TemplarStartsFight_10.text: In a way, I suppose you will, vin'iisk.

AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster_0.text: Your chance has come. Place the artefact - or know my rage.

AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelGoesToPlanecaster_1.text: Place the artefact. Or do not, and feel my bite.

SWD_Templar_28.speaker: Narrator
SWD_Templar_28.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SWD_Templar_21.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
SWD_Templar_21.text: The Inquisition... To find... The artefact... The Astral Prism...

SWD_Templar_16.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
SWD_Templar_16.text: A secret... Used by Gith... To free us... Of ghaik shackles...

SWD_Templar_4.speaker: Narrator
SWD_Templar_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SWD_Templar_7.speaker: Player
SWD_Templar_7.text: What will the githyanki do now?

SWD_Templar_33.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
SWD_Templar_33.text: The god-corpse Tu'narath... Palace of Whispers...

SWD_Templar_22.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
SWD_Templar_22.text: A front... Masking... The Grand Design...

SWD_Templar_0.speaker: Player
SWD_Templar_0.text: Isn't the Grand Design just a ghaik myth?

SWD_Templar_32.speaker: Narrator
SWD_Templar_32.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SWD_Templar_34.speaker: Narrator
SWD_Templar_34.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
